conclusion: Determine the minimum area of paper required to cover each face of the cube.
The cube has a side length of a, refractive index n = 1.5, and a bubble at the center.
Critical angle calculation: sin θc = 1/n, θc = sin^(-1)(2/3).
The bubble is at the center of the cube, distance from bubble to any face is a/2.
Paper must cover area on each face such that light rays from the bubble do not exit the cube.
Area to be covered is a circle with radius r = (a/2) tan θc.
Calculate tan θc = (2/3) / (√5/3) = 2/√5, so r = a/√5.
Area of the circle A = π r^2 = π (a/√5)^2 = π a^2/5.
Final answer: Minimum area of each piece of paper is π a^2/5.
